articles.title: Dutch Restaurant Vocabulary for Dining Out
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Dutch cuisine may be understated, but dining out in the Netherlands is a wonderful experience. From cozy cafes to elegant restaurants, knowing the right vocabulary will help you navigate menus and enjoy romantic dinners with your partner.

## Essential Opening Phrase

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Een tafel voor twee, alstublieft"
  translation="A table for two, please"
  pronunciation="ayn TA-fel for TWAY, al-stoo-BLEEFT"
  context="The first phrase you'll need when entering a restaurant with your partner."
/>

## Arriving at the Restaurant

<VocabCard
  word="Goedenavond"
  translation="Good evening"
  pronunciation="KHOO-den-a-font"
  example="Goedenavond, heeft u een vrije tafel?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Heeft u gereserveerd?"
  translation="Do you have a reservation?"
  pronunciation="hayft oo khe-re-ser-VAYRT?"
  example="What the host might ask you."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We hebben een reservering op naam van..."
  translation="We have a reservation under the name..."
  pronunciation="vuh HEB-ben ayn re-ser-VE-ring op NAHM fan..."
  example="We hebben een reservering op naam van De Vries."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mogen we de menukaart?"
  translation="May we have the menu?"
  pronunciation="MO-khen vuh duh me-NOO-kahrt?"
  example="Asking for the menu."
/>

<CultureTip title="Dutch Restaurant Etiquette" flag="üá≥üá±">
The Dutch are generally direct and efficient. Don't expect excessive attention from waiters - they give you space to enjoy your meal. Make eye contact or raise your hand slightly when you need service. It's not rude; it's Dutch!
</CultureTip>

## Reading the Menu

### Menu Sections

| Dutch | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Menukaart** | me-NOO-kahrt | Menu |
| **Voorgerechten** | FOR-khe-rekh-ten | Starters |
| **Salades** | sa-LA-des | Salads |
| **Soepen** | SOO-pen | Soups |
| **Hoofdgerechten** | HOHFT-khe-rekh-ten | Main courses |
| **Vlees** | flays | Meat |
| **Vis** | fis | Fish |
| **Bijgerechten** | BAI-khe-rekh-ten | Side dishes |
| **Nagerechten** | NAH-khe-rekh-ten | Desserts |
| **Dranken** | DRAN-ken | Drinks |

<VocabCard
  word="Wat kunt u aanbevelen?"
  translation="What can you recommend?"
  pronunciation="vat kuhnt oo AHN-be-fay-len?"
  example="A great way to discover local favorites."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wat is de specialiteit van het huis?"
  translation="What's the specialty of the house?"
  pronunciation="vat is duh spe-see-a-li-TAYT fan het huis?"
  example="Ask about their signature dish."
/>

## Ordering Food

<VocabCard
  word="We zijn klaar om te bestellen"
  translation="We're ready to order"
  pronunciation="vuh zain klahr om tuh be-STEL-len"
  example="Signal to the waiter you're ready."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ik neem..."
  translation="I'll have..."
  pronunciation="ik naym..."
  example="Ik neem de biefstuk."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Voor mij..."
  translation="For me..."
  pronunciation="for mai..."
  example="Voor mij graag de zalm."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="En voor mijn vriendin/vriend"
  translation="And for my girlfriend/boyfriend"
  pronunciation="en for main FREEN-din / freent"
  example="Ordering for your partner."
/>

### Dietary Preferences

<VocabCard
  word="Ik ben vegetarisch"
  translation="I'm vegetarian"
  pronunciation="ik ben ve-khe-TA-rees"
  example="Heeft u vegetarische opties?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Zonder vlees, alstublieft"
  translation="Without meat, please"
  pronunciation="ZON-der flays, al-stoo-BLEEFT"
  example="Request for no meat."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ik heb een allergie voor..."
  translation="I'm allergic to..."
  pronunciation="ik hep ayn a-ler-KHEE for..."
  example="Ik heb een allergie voor noten."
/>

<CultureTip title="Dutch Culinary Culture" flag="üá≥üá±">
While Dutch cuisine is often simple, the Netherlands has excellent international restaurants. Traditional dishes include stamppot (mashed potatoes with vegetables), bitterballen (fried snacks), and fresh herring. The Dutch also love their cheese - try some local varieties!
</CultureTip>

## Drinks

| Dutch | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Water** | VA-ter | Water |
| **Wijn** | vain | Wine |
| **Bier** | beer | Beer |
| **Thee** | tay | Tea |
| **Koffie** | KOF-fee | Coffee |
| **Sap** | sap | Juice |
| **Spa (rood/blauw)** | spa (roht/blou) | Sparkling/Still water |
| **Jenever** | ye-NAY-ver | Dutch gin |

<VocabCard
  word="Een glas rode/witte wijn"
  translation="A glass of red/white wine"
  pronunciation="ayn khlas RO-duh / VI-tuh vain"
  example="Twee glazen rode wijn, alstublieft."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Een fles water, alstublieft"
  translation="A bottle of water, please"
  pronunciation="ayn fles VA-ter, al-stoo-BLEEFT"
  example="Met of zonder prik? (Sparkling or still?)"
/>

## During the Meal

<VocabCard
  word="Eet smakelijk!"
  translation="Enjoy your meal!"
  pronunciation="ayt SMA-ke-lik!"
  example="Say this before eating."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Het is heerlijk!"
  translation="It's delicious!"
  pronunciation="het is HAYR-lik!"
  example="Compliment the food."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mogen we nog wat brood?"
  translation="May we have more bread?"
  pronunciation="MO-khen vuh nokh vat broht?"
  example="Request more bread."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Zout en peper, alstublieft"
  translation="Salt and pepper, please"
  pronunciation="zout en PAY-per, al-stoo-BLEEFT"
  example="Ask for seasonings."
/>

### Describing Food

| Dutch | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Lekker** | LEK-ker | Delicious |
| **Zout** | zout | Salty |
| **Zoet** | zoot | Sweet |
| **Pittig** | PIT-tikh | Spicy |
| **Warm** | varm | Hot |
| **Koud** | kout | Cold |
| **Vers** | fers | Fresh |

## Paying the Bill

<VocabCard
  word="De rekening, alstublieft"
  translation="The bill, please"
  pronunciation="duh RAY-ke-ning, al-stoo-BLEEFT"
  example="The most important phrase at the end!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Kan ik met pin betalen?"
  translation="Can I pay by card?"
  pronunciation="kan ik met pin be-TA-len?"
  example="Check if they accept cards (PIN is the Dutch term for debit card)."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We betalen samen"
  translation="We're paying together"
  pronunciation="vuh be-TA-len SA-men"
  example="One bill for the couple."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Apart, alstublieft"
  translation="Separately, please"
  pronunciation="a-PART, al-stoo-BLEEFT"
  example="Split the bill."
/>

<CultureTip title="Tipping in the Netherlands" flag="üá≥üá±">
Tipping is not mandatory in the Netherlands as service is included. However, rounding up or leaving 5-10% for good service is appreciated. You can say "houd het wisselgeld" (hout het VI-sel-khelt - keep the change) or leave coins on the table.
</CultureTip>

## Useful Table Items

| Dutch | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| **Bord** | bort | Plate |
| **Vork** | fork | Fork |
| **Mes** | mes | Knife |
| **Lepel** | LAY-pel | Spoon |
| **Glas** | khlas | Glass |
| **Kopje** | KOP-ye | Cup |
| **Servet** | ser-VET | Napkin |
| **Fles** | fles | Bottle |

## Romantic Phrases for Dinner

<VocabCard
  word="Proost!"
  translation="Cheers!"
  pronunciation="prohst!"
  example="A simple toast."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Op de liefde!"
  translation="To love!"
  pronunciation="op duh LEEF-duh!"
  example="A romantic toast."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Je ziet er prachtig uit vanavond"
  translation="You look beautiful tonight"
  pronunciation="yuh zeet er PRAKH-tikh out fa-NA-font"
  example="Compliment your partner."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ik geniet ervan om tijd met je door te brengen"
  translation="I enjoy spending time with you"
  pronunciation="ik khe-NEET er-fan om tait met yuh dor tuh BRENG-en"
  example="Express your feelings."
/>

## Common Problems and Solutions

<VocabCard
  word="Sorry, dit is niet wat ik besteld heb"
  translation="Sorry, this isn't what I ordered"
  pronunciation="SO-ree, dit is neet vat ik be-STELT hep"
  example="Politely address a wrong order."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dit is te koud"
  translation="This is too cold"
  pronunciation="dit is tuh kout"
  example="Ask for food to be reheated."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Waar is het toilet?"
  translation="Where is the restroom?"
  pronunciation="vahr is het twa-LET?"
  example="A necessary question!"
/>

## Making Reservations

<VocabCard
  word="Ik wil graag een tafel reserveren"
  translation="I'd like to reserve a table"
  pronunciation="ik vil khrahkh ayn TA-fel re-ser-VAY-ren"
  example="Start a phone reservation."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Voor hoe laat?"
  translation="For what time?"
  pronunciation="for hoo laht?"
  example="They'll ask when."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Voor acht uur"
  translation="For 8 o'clock"
  pronunciation="for akht oor"
  example="Specify the time."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Voor twee personen"
  translation="For two people"
  pronunciation="for tway per-SO-nen"
  example="Specify the number of guests."
/>

## Quick Reference

### Arriving
- Goedenavond - Good evening
- Een tafel voor twee - Table for two
- We hebben gereserveerd - We have a reservation

### Ordering
- De menukaart, alstublieft - Menu, please
- Ik neem... - I'll have...
- Wat kunt u aanbevelen? - What do you recommend?

### During Meal
- Eet smakelijk! - Enjoy your meal!
- Heerlijk! - Delicious!
- Nog wat water, alstublieft - More water, please

### Paying
- De rekening, alstublieft - The bill, please
- Kan ik pinnen? - Can I pay by card?
- Bedankt, het was heerlijk - Thank you, it was delicious

<CTA />

articles.title: Rum√§nisch Kosenamen und Liebkosungen f√ºr Paare
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Rum√§nisch Kosenamen und Liebkosungen f√ºr Paare

Kosenamen sind eine wunderbare Art, deinem Partner zu zeigen, wie viel er oder sie dir bedeutet. Wenn dein Partner Rum√§nisch spricht, wird es ihn oder sie sicher freuen, wenn du diese liebevollen Ausdr√ºcke verwendest!

## Warum Kosenamen wichtig sind

Kosenamen schaffen Intimit√§t und zeigen Zuneigung. Sie sind wie ein geheimes Band zwischen zwei Menschen ‚Äì etwas Besonderes, das nur euch beiden geh√∂rt.

## Klassische Kosenamen

Die zeitlosen Klassiker funktionieren in jeder Sprache:

- **Schatz** - der universelle Liebling
- **Liebling** - klassisch und elegant
- **Mein Herz** - gef√ºhlvoll und poetisch
- **Meine Liebe** - romantisch und z√§rtlich

<CultureTip>
Kosenamen variieren oft von Region zu Region. Was in einer Gegend √ºblich ist, kann anderswo ungew√∂hnlich klingen. Frage deinen Partner, welche Namen in seiner Heimat gebr√§uchlich sind!
</CultureTip>

## S√º√üe Tiernamen

Wie in vielen Kulturen werden auch im Rum√§nischen gerne Tiernamen verwendet:

- **B√§rchen** (kleiner B√§r) - kuschelig und stark
- **M√§uschen** (kleine Maus) - s√º√ü und niedlich
- **H√§schen** (kleiner Hase) - z√§rtlich
- **Sp√§tzchen** (kleiner Spatz) - liebevoll

## Romantische Ausdr√ºcke

F√ºr besondere Momente:

- **Mein Ein und Alles** - wenn jemand alles f√ºr dich ist
- **Seelenverwandter** - f√ºr tiefe Verbindungen
- **Mein Sonnenschein** - f√ºr jemanden, der dein Leben erhellt

## Kosenamen f√ºr verschiedene Anl√§sse

### Im Alltag
Kurze, lockere Namen f√ºr den t√§glichen Gebrauch. Ein schnelles "Hey, Schatz!" funktioniert immer.

### F√ºr romantische Momente
L√§ngere, gef√ºhlvollere Ausdr√ºcke passen zu besonderen Momenten. Sag deinem Partner, was er oder sie dir bedeutet.

### Zum Necken
Humorvolle Kosenamen k√∂nnen eure Beziehung auflockern ‚Äì aber achte darauf, dass dein Partner den Humor teilt!

## Tipps zur Verwendung

1. **Frage deinen Partner**: Nicht jeder mag jeden Kosenamen. Frage, was ihm/ihr gef√§llt.
2. **Achte auf die Aussprache**: √úbe die richtige Aussprache ‚Äì nichts ist romantischer als ein korrekt ausgesprochener Kosename.
3. **Sei authentisch**: Verwende Namen, die zu euch als Paar passen.
4. **Kreiere eigene Namen**: Die pers√∂nlichsten Kosenamen sind oft selbst erfunden!
5. **Beobachte die Reaktion**: Der beste Kosename ist der, bei dem dein Partner l√§chelt.

## Die Kraft der Sprache

Kosenamen sind mehr als Worte ‚Äì sie sind kleine Liebeserkl√§rungen im Alltag. Wenn du Rum√§nisch lernst, um mit deinem Partner zu kommunizieren, sind Kosenamen ein wundervoller Anfang.

<CTA />

articles.title: Zwroty na pierwszƒÖ randkƒô po szwedzku
articles.content:
Pierwsza randka to ekscytujƒÖcy moment. Oto kluczowe zwroty, kt√≥re pomogƒÖ Ci zrobiƒá ≈õwietne wra≈ºenie.

## Rozpoczƒôcie rozmowy

### Cze≈õƒá! Mi≈Ço Ciƒô wreszcie poznaƒá!
Ciep≈Çe powitanie, kt√≥re pokazuje entuzjazm.

### ≈öwietnie wyglƒÖdasz!
Prosty, szczery komplement.

### Nie mog≈Çem/mog≈Çam siƒô doczekaƒá
Pokazuje zainteresowanie.

## Poznawanie siƒô

### Opowiedz mi o sobie
Klasyczne otwarcie do g≈Çƒôbszej rozmowy.

### Co lubisz robiƒá w wolnym czasie?
Poznawanie hobby i zainteresowa≈Ñ.

### Jaki jest Tw√≥j ulubiony...?
Film, ksiƒÖ≈ºka, jedzenie - ≈õwietny spos√≥b na poznanie gust√≥w.

## Wyra≈ºanie zainteresowania

### To naprawdƒô interesujƒÖce
Pokazuje, ≈ºe s≈Çuchasz aktywnie.

### Opowiedz mi wiƒôcej
Zachƒôca do kontynuowania.

### Chcia≈Çbym/Chcia≈Çabym wiedzieƒá wiƒôcej
Wyra≈ºa autentyczne zainteresowanie.

## Dzielenie siƒô o sobie

### Pasjonujƒô siƒô...
Dzielenie siƒô swoimi zainteresowaniami.

### Zawsze chcia≈Çem/chcia≈Çam...
Dzielenie siƒô marzeniami.

## Komplementy

### Uwielbiam Tw√≥j u≈õmiech
Szczery, osobisty komplement.

### Masz ≈õwietne poczucie humoru
Docenianie osobowo≈õci.

### ≈öwietnie siƒô z TobƒÖ bawiƒô
Pokazuje, ≈ºe randka idzie dobrze.

## Planowanie nastƒôpnego spotkania

### Bardzo chcia≈Çbym/chcia≈Çabym Ciƒô znowu zobaczyƒá
Bezpo≈õrednie wyra≈ºenie zainteresowania.

### Kiedy mo≈ºemy to powt√≥rzyƒá?
Konkretna propozycja.

### Mia≈Çem/Mia≈Çam cudowny wiecz√≥r
Podsumowanie randki.

## Po≈ºegnanie

### To by≈Ço naprawdƒô cudowne
Ciep≈Çe po≈ºegnanie.

### Nie mogƒô siƒô doczekaƒá kolejnego spotkania
Pokazuje entuzjazm.

Lycka till! (Powodzenia!)

articles.title: 30+ Franske Komplimenter til Din Partner: Romantiske Fraser
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Komplimenter er k√¶rlighedens lille daglige vitamin. Et par velvalgte ord p√• din partners modersm√•l kan forvandle en almindelig dag til noget s√¶rligt. I denne guide finder du over 30 smukke komplimenter p√• fransk. Kombiner med vores [franske k√¶lenavne](/learn/da/fr/french-pet-names-and-endearments/) for maksimal romantisk effekt!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="You're beautiful"
  translation="Du er smuk"
  pronunciation="joor byu-ti-ful"
  context="En romantisk kompliment p√• fransk"
/>

## Komplimenter om Udseende

De klassiske komplimenter der f√•r din partner til at f√∏le sig smuk:

<VocabCard
  word="You're beautiful"
  translation="Du er smuk"
  pronunciation="joor byu-ti-ful"
  example="You look beautiful today."
/>

| Fransk | Dansk | Udtale | Bruges til |
|---------|-------|--------|------------|
| **You're beautiful** | Du er smuk | joor byu-ti-ful | Kvinder |
| **You're handsome** | Du er flot | joor han-sam | M√¶nd |
| **You're gorgeous** | Du er fantastisk smuk | joor gor-jus | Alle |
| **You're attractive** | Du er tiltr√¶kkende | joor uh-trak-tiv | Alle |
| **You're stunning** | Du er betagende | joor stu-ning | Alle |

### Specifikke Komplimenter

- **You have beautiful eyes** (Du har smukke √∏jne) - "juu hav byu-ti-ful aiz"
- **Your smile is amazing** (Dit smil er fantastisk) - "joor smail iz uh-mei-zing"
- **You look great in that** (Du ser godt ud i det) - "juu luk greit in dat"
- **I love your hair** (Jeg elsker dit h√•r) - "ai lav joor hehr"

<CultureTip flag="üá´üá∑" title="Komplimentkultur">
Engl√¶ndere kan v√¶re subtile med komplimenter. 'You look nice' er h√∏jt ros!
</CultureTip>

## Komplimenter om Personlighed

Disse komplimenter r√∏rer hjertet endnu dybere:

<VocabCard
  word="You're so kind"
  translation="Du er venlig"
  pronunciation="joor sou kaind"
  example="You're so kind to everyone."
/>

| Fransk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **You're so kind** | Du er venlig | joor sou kaind |
| **You're smart** | Du er klog | joor smart |
| **You're funny** | Du er sjov | joor fa-ni |
| **You're caring** | Du er omsorgsfuld | joor keh-ring |
| **You're brave** | Du er modig | joor breiv |
| **You're talented** | Du er talentfuld | joor ta-len-ted |

### Dybere Komplimenter

- **You inspire me** (Du inspirerer mig)
- **You make me a better person** (Du g√∏r mig til et bedre menneske)
- **I'm so lucky to have you** (Jeg er s√• heldig at have dig)
- **You're amazing** (Du er fantastisk)

## Romantiske Komplimenter

- **I love everything about you** (Jeg elsker alt ved dig) - "ai lav ev-ri-thing uh-baut juu"
- **You're perfect for me** (Du er perfekt for mig) - "joor pur-fekt for mi"
- **You're my dream** (Du er min dr√∏m) - "joor mai driim"
- **You're my everything** (Du er mit alt) - "joor mai ev-ri-thing"

<CultureTip flag="üá´üá∑" title="Timing">
Giv komplimenter spontant for st√∏rst effekt.
</CultureTip>

## Hverdagskomplimenter

<VocabCard
  word="Your cooking is amazing"
  translation="Din mad smager fantastisk"
  pronunciation="joor ku-king iz uh-mei-zing"
  example="Your cooking is always so good!"
/>

| Situation | Fransk | Dansk |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| Madlavning | **Your cooking is amazing** | Din mad smager fantastisk |
| Arbejde | **You work so hard** | Du arbejder s√• h√•rdt |
| Hj√¶lp | **You're so helpful** | Du er s√• hj√¶lpsom |
| Humor | **You always make me laugh** | Du f√•r mig altid til at grine |

## Komplimenter til Specielle Lejligheder

### Til en Date
- **You look amazing tonight** (Du ser fantastisk ud i aften)
- **I enjoy every moment with you** (Jeg nyder hvert √∏jeblik med dig)

### Ved Milep√¶le
- **I'm so proud of you** (Jeg er s√• stolt af dig)
- **You've done so well** (Du har klaret det s√• godt)

## Tips til at Give Komplimenter

1. **V√¶r specifik** - "Du har smukke √∏jne" sl√•r "Du er p√¶n"
2. **M√©n det** - Din partner kan m√¶rke om det er √¶gte
3. **Overrask** - Give komplimenter p√• uventede tidspunkter
4. **Varier** - Komplimenter ikke altid det samme
5. **Brug fransk** - Det betyder mere p√• deres modersm√•l

For flere romantiske udtryk, tjek [franske romantiske fraser](/learn/da/fr/french-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

En kompliment p√• fransk er mere end ord ‚Äì det er en gave af k√¶rlighed.

<CTA />

articles.title: –ò—Ç–∞–ª—å—è–Ω—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã –æ –ø—Ä–æ—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏
articles.content:
–ò—Ç–∞–ª—å—è–Ω—Ü—ã –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–∞—é—Ç —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ –∏ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–æ. –ü—Ä–æ—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ ‚Äî –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–æ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å —Å –æ–±—ä—è—Ç–∏—è–º–∏, —Å–ª–µ–∑–∞–º–∏ –∏ –∏—Å–∫—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–º–∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º–∏.

## –§—Ä–∞–∑—ã –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ—Å—å–±—ã –æ –ø—Ä–æ—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏

### 1. Mi dispiace davvero per quello che ho fatto
**–ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ:** –ú–∏ –¥–∏—Å–ø—å—èÃÅ—á–µ –¥–∞–≤–≤–µÃÅ—Ä–æ –ø—ç—Ä –∫—É—çÃÅ–ª–ª–æ –∫—ç –æ —Ñ–∞ÃÅ—Ç—Ç–æ

## –ö—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ã–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏

–í –ò—Ç–∞–ª–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ ‚Äî —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–±—ã—Ç–∏–µ. –û–±—ä—è—Ç–∏—è, –ø–æ—Ü–µ–ª—É–∏, –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Å–ª—ë–∑—ã ‚Äî –≤—Å—ë —ç—Ç–æ —á–∞—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞. –§—Ä–∞–∑–∞ ¬´Ti chiedo perdono dal profondo del cuore¬ª (–ü—Ä–æ—à—É –ø—Ä–æ—â–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–∞) –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–∞–µ—Ç –≥–ª—É–±–∏–Ω—É —Ä–∞—Å–∫–∞—è–Ω–∏—è.
